intro: Talisia pachycarpa, commonly known as the thick-fruited talisia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are thick-walled capsules that contain numerous small seeds. Talisia pachycarpa is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
